oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery interviews Sawyer Brown
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Sawyer Brown (performance group) for the Ralph Emery Show. The recording is from April 04, 1988.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Sawyer Brown
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:05) Emery introduces Sawyer Brown, and invites Mark Miller, Gregg "Hobie" Hubbard and Bobby Randall and discuss how people misconstrue that Sawyer Brown is a person -- (01:58) Sawyer Brown and Emery joke about why Sawyer brown recorded in Fort Lauderdale -- (03:45) Emery inquires as to why Sawyer brown chose its name -- (06:00) Emery and Sawyer brown discuss how country bands had difficulties establishing themselves -- (07:13) Emery jokes about how "This Missing You Heart of Mine" is falling on the charts, and Miller reveals "Old Photograph" is to be released the same week -- (08:28) Emery inquires about the vocal ranges of the members of Sawyer Brown -- (08:58) Emery praises the music video of "Betty's Bein' Bad," and Randell reveals that they polled their fans -- (10:33) Emery inquires about how old Sawyer Brown is, and Emery asks the group to create a chronological map of their releases -- (14:59) Emery inquires as to why the nickname 'Hobie' stuck, and Emery inquires about Randell's background -- (16:38) Emery inquires about the rest of the band's nicknames, and the members of Sawyer Brown reflect on their early traveling struggles -- (23:26) Emery inquires about Sawyer Brown's bus payments -- (25:52) Emery inquires about Sawyer Brown's work with Kenny Rogers and Dolly Parton -- (26:34) Emery asks the members of Sawyer Brown if they were mistreated while opening for Rogers and Parton; additionally, Emery recalls a heckler that heckled him, the Oaks, and Rogers -- (31:05) Sawyer Brown reveals they met opening for Don King -- (33:25) Emery invites Sawyer Brown to reflect on how one gets a job in Nashville -- (35:03) Emery asks Sawyer Brown if they had don't all they had set out to do; additionally, Sawyer Brown discuss their work with Capitol Records and Star Search -- (38:42) Emery inquires about how Sawyer Brown got work before Sawyer Brown -- (41:55) Emery asks about the marital status of Sawyer Brown; additionally, Emery inquires about any music videos Sawyer Brown have planned -- (49:07) Emery inquires about Sawyer brown's new album, and all of the group say their goodbyes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Sawyer Brown; Sawyer Brown (Musical group);
